title: 4-H Summer Camps
address: 5390 4 H Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
description:
Meet new people, have fun, and experience the great outdoors with Oregon 4-H this summer. You belong here!

Have you paddled a canoe, ridden a horse or made a tie dyed shirt before? 4-H Camp provides opportunities to learn about wildlife, natural science, technology (GPS or Robots), astronomy and even cooking! 4-H Camps, like all 4-H programs, focus on helping youth find their spark, learn lifelong skills, and thrive as leaders, explorers, and innovators.  So check it out, and find the camp that is right for you. Which ever camp you pick, it will be the best thing you did all summer! All youth are welcome at any session of 4-H Summer Camp, and you don't have to be a 4-H member to join us. Camp is for everyone! We have seven different weeks to choose from this year, each with its own host counties and theme, so find a week that works for you, and know that you'll be making local friends and memories that last a lifetime.

For 3rd-5th Graders:

Wildlife Stewards camp: July 3-6
Multicultural Celebration: August 8–12

For 4th–8th Graders:

4 Rivers Camp: June 28–July 2
July Wild West Camp:  July 11–15
August Wild West Camp:  August 15–19
Clackamas County 4-H Camp: July 18–22
This year's theme is Stars and Constellations
Multicultural Celebration: August 8–12

For All Grades:

August 8-12 is a multicultural celebration with campers from Grades 3–8 coming together for a week of fun and learning with an added focus on Spanish-language options and cultural experiences for all! 

Most activities at Multicultural Camp will be either for grades 3-5 or 4-8, and cabins and groups will be separated by age.

title: Crafty Mindz
address: 1150 SW 170th Ave, Beaverton, OR 97006, USA
description:
Crafty Mindz is designed to build children's creativity, confidence, patience, fine motor skills, focus, and a lot more! We offer Child Care, Before and After School Programs, Camps (Summer camp, Spring camp, and Winter camp), Paint events, and parties for all age groups.

CHILD CARE: We provide different child care services with a program tailored towards a child's overall development. Our program includes a variety of featured activities providing a daily dose of creativity and an overall learning experience. We offer:

Child Care Program (Infant to Preschool)
Before & After School Program/Care
No School Day Camp

CAMPS: Our themed arts and activity camps are the perfect place for your child to learn and have fun throughout the year. We offer weekly and monthly pricing during the summer as well as other camps throughout the year during school breaks. We offer:

Spring Break Camps
Summer Camps
Winter Camps

MATERIALS: We provide all the supplies for all our programs and are always included in our pricing.

HEALTH AND SAFETY: We take health and safety very seriously and follow CDC guidelines and other protocols to ensure the well-being of students and staff.

title: One River School of Art + Design
address: 15010 Bangy Rd, Lake Oswego, OR 97035, USA
description:
Welcome to the One River School of Art + Design community! We offer fun Camps, in-studio and online classes, and birthday parties for grades K-12th and adults. We have a unique method for teaching art and design that allows students to have fun, build friendships, be creative, make inspiring artwork, and learn about contemporary art and artists while growing their skills and techniques.  We welcome all skill levels and provide both group and one-on-one support for each student.

CLASSES: Our in-studio and online classes are ongoing and year-round which means you can jump in at any time. We offer focused classes such as Focus on Drawing and Animation as well as general classes like Art Shuffle that span a range of techniques and mediums.

CAMPS: We offer Spring Break Camps, Summer Camps, and Winter Camps. Most of our camps are week-long with morning and afternoon options. Our camps range from Realistic Portrait Drawing and Street Art Painting to Digital Manga.

CURRICULUM: Each lesson for camps and classes is based on contemporary artists and their practice. Students will learn techniques, skills, vocabulary, and knowledge related to and about each artist’s way of creating.

TEACHERS: Teachers at One River School of Art + Design are carefully screened so that our students are provided with the right amount of technical support and individualized attention. Our research shows that when people are learning new creative concepts, it is important to have a teacher who instills trust and also has the skills to provide an inspiring lesson.

MATERIALS: We supply each student with their own bin of materials.

FACILITY: Our innovative facility is equipped with the latest technology which includes flat-screen TVs in each room, iPads for each teacher, and in the digital lab, touch-screen computers with stylist pens. We also have a gallery space to engage and inspire students. Here we exhibit both national and international professional artists as well as our own student-artists.

HEALTH AND SAFETY: We take health and safety very seriously and follow CDC guidelines and other protocols to ensure the well-being of students and staff.

title: Saturday Academy
address: 5000 N Willamette Blvd, Portland, OR 97203, USA
description: Saturday Academy provides wide access to hands-on learning for diverse students in grades 2-12 in the areas of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Math (STEAM). Since 1983, as one of Oregon’s leading education nonprofits, our community experts have sparked curiosity and love of learning in over 190,000 young people. Our four programs, Open Enrollment Classes and Camps, Afterschool (SA2U), Apprenticeships for Science and Engineering (ASE) and Girls Engage Technology (GET) inspire 2nd-12th grade students through hands-on education, taught by community experts, during out-of-school time.

title: Vibe of Portland
address: 6520 N Salem Ave, Portland, OR 97203, USA
description:
Vibe of Portland is offering both half-day and full-day camps this summer, held in-person and with COVID-19 safety precautions. Vibe's summer camps encourage imaginative thinking and inspire your child to look at the world from new perspectives, through art! Campers learn a variety of techniques, hone their artistic skills, and develop friendships. Vibe offers a variety of subjects, from mixed media, illustration and drawing, environmental-based art, creating art from the world around us, and more! For music fans, Vibe is offering a musical theater camp for all levels, and a flute and clarinet camp for grades 6-10.

Vibe is an Art and Music educational nonprofit committed to ensuring equitable access to quality arts education experiences for long-term positive growth and is currently reimagining their in-person arts education offerings when all emerge from this global pandemic. They are fortunate to be able to offer in-person summer camps on sites with plenty of outdoor, and indoor space. Vibe's instructors are vaccinated, and masks are to be worn by all, teachers and students.

title: Pedalheads USA
description:
Pedalheads is a learn-to-ride week-long bike camp for kids 2 and up, best known for helping kids get off of training wheels and riding on their own. We combine a fun group setting with specialized equipment, tailored cycling lessons, and incredible instructors to build confidence and get some of the most tentative kids biking on their own. We also offer advanced bike lessons that focus on road safety in addition to, trail riding camps.

Why Pedalheads?

Proven track record over the last 25 years: Most kids learn to ride within 1 week
Winner of several Parents Choice Awards for Best Children’s Day Camp
Fully trained instructors for beginner and advanced levels
Weekly Half-day, All-day, and 1.5hr Tots options

Located throughout the Portland Metro area in the summer including: Beaverton, Hillsboro, Lake Oswego, Alameda, Laurelhurst, SW Portland, Sellwood/Reed, and University Park

Register Today!

title: Aim High Martial Arts Camps & Events!
address: 16205 NW Bethany Ct, Beaverton, OR 97006, USA
description: Aim High Martial Arts & Events are part of a small 501(c)3 non-profit organization that works to provide a variety of resources to families in it's community. In addition to camps, the Aim High team provides Birthday Parties, Martial Arts Classes, Screenprinting, and Parent's Night Out kids events!

title: Summer at OES

description: In-person programs for ages 4-17. River Runners, Rock Climbing, Theater, Outdoor Exploration, Fencing, Design & Engineering, and more! Visit www.oes.edu/summer.

title: Balance Soccer Summer Camps
address: 18062 Keasey Rd, Vernonia, OR 97064, USA
description:
CONNECT + PLAY + LEARN
 

The most FUN, OVERNIGHT soccer camps ever!  Bunk with your friends and teammates after a long day of nonstop FUN!  No cell phones, video games, or indoor classrooms here!  This extraordinary, all-inclusive camp in the woods of Vernonia will get your kids out into nature in a safe space to play and explore.

Camps are uniquely designed to develop soccer skills, encourage personal responsibility, and improve self awareness. The Balance Soccer Founder and Camp Director, Tyler Pagano, will be there to guide parents and campers through it all.

Boys Camp June 22-26 / Girls Camp July 16-20

title: French American International School
address: 8500 NW Johnson St, Portland, OR 97229, USA
description:
French American International School  provides an exceptional independent school education through the dynamic convergence of language immersion and the IB World School framework. On a beautiful, 15-acre campus in Portland, a global mindset contributes to the school’s collaborative, inquiry-based approach to learning, its open-minded community of families, and the deep value it places on diversity of experiences and cultures starting from the earliest ages. Using language as a powerful tool for learning, French International educates students from a global perspective that prepares them to engage with inclusivity, achieve with integrity, and excel with distinction.

title: The Hangout
address: 4707 SE Belmont St, Portland, OR 97215, USA
description: Creative, safe, educational, after school care that your kids will LOVE. We designed The Hangout for you and your kids. We believe that kids should love their after school care and come home excited to talk to you about out all the things they have created and learned. At The Hangout we offer your child the freedom to make their own choices, explore new ideas, engage socially, and learn and grow! The Hangout is a space where kids ages 5-13 years-old can hangout, engage with friends, stimulate their minds with creative activities, and learn self-direction. More of a club than a program, at The Hangout we provide a wide variety of arts, crafts, games and technologies and then support our members as they follow their own interests.

description: School of Send offers kids mountain bike camps in Hood River, OR. title: My Voice Music Rock Camp
address: 3520 SE Yamhill St, Portland, OR 97214, USA
description:
Form a Band! Write, record & perform your own songs!
Take home a professional recording of your music —and so much more: confidence, pride, and a new community of friends.

Summer Rock Camps at My Voice Music offer an intro to writing, recording and performing music for Portland-area youth ages 9-13.

Ages 9-13
No experience necessary
Cost: $0-$450. 
Scholarships available. No one turned away for lack of funds.
REGISTER HERE

Campers work with experienced Teaching Artists to:

Learn how to play new instruments and sing
Improve their skills on instruments they already play
Write songs
Form a band and perform for friends & family on stage on the last day of camp
Record in our professional studio and take home a CD of their songs

Scholarships

My Voice Music provides sliding-scale scholarships automatically, no questions asked. If you are able to pay for programs, please do! MVM will not turn away any youth for financial reasons. Please email register@myvoicemusic.org to obtain a scholarship form or discount code that best fits your circumstances, or to request a spot on the waiting list.

About MVM

My Voice Music is a nonprofit that amplify's young voices and ignites self-discovery through writing, recording, and performing original music. Our vision is that all youth have the opportunity to find and share their artistic voice. In addition to rock camps, we have these awesome programs that reach over 2,000 kids a year:

MVM Studios is our full recording studio and performance space in SE Portland that is open to the public where music classes, rock camps, and recording sessions take place.

Outreach Programs bring all the instruments and instruction to schools, residential facilities, and youth centers to run songwriting based music programs and workshops.

title: PIVOT PDX Performing Arts Summer Camps
address: 5131 NE 23rd Ave, Portland, OR 97211, USA
description:
At PIVOT PDX Summer Camps, kids will explore performing as an outlet for creativity, artistry, humor, and expression. We teach, model, and normalize using our bodies for expression and the stage for sharing.

The tenets of camp curriculum are: 1) the power and gift of music, 2) our natural response to move our bodies when we hear/feel rhythm and beat, and 3) performance as a means of sharing and being seen.

Students will engage in a myriad of activities that will introduce them to the stage. Activities such as charades, musical dots, find the beat, pass the move, sketch comedy, hand puppets, and karaoke will be explored. With all of the fun and excitement, students don't realize they are performing, but each time they present in front of their peers, they are growing in their confidence!

PIVOT PDX Camps are held at the Historic Alberta House in the Alberta Arts District of NE Portland. All camps are directed by Lauren Kawa Funk and a team of junior coach interns (camp alumni who are now in high school) who grow in their leadership and creative skills as they guide and support campers throughout the week. We will honor each camper’s individual journey and the unique talents they are comfortable sharing.

Six week-long camps will run in Summer 2023 for kids rising into grades 1st-8th in fall 2023. Camps run Mon-Friday from 8:30am-1pm with an aftercare option until 4:30pm. No experience necessary though a general appreciation for movement and music is appreciated.

Mutual aid/no pay spots are available in each camp. Mutual aid is solidarity-based support for marginalized communities. Email hello@thisispivotpdx.com for a Mutual Aid spot.

title: Merry Mystics Spirit Camp
address: 4525 SE Stark St, Portland, OR 97215, USA
description:
Welcome to Merry Mystics Spirit Camps!

The summer camp where kids learn extraordinary spiritual life skills to empower them to thrive at any challenge.

We know school nourishes our minds, sports nourishes our bodies, but who nourishes our Inner Being?

That's where Spirit Camp comes in!

In 2023, we offer week-long summer day camps, as well as workshops and Saturday day camps in Feb, March, and April.

Sign up at our website: www.merrymystics.love

At camp, our Spiritual Superstars learn:

Self Confidence & Inner Empowerment:

✦ Connect to their inner wisdom and intuition
✹ Discern the voices of their Inner Champion and Inner Critic
✦ Use affirmations to connect with their self worth and power

Connecting to Nature

✦ Practice mindfulness in Nature with all senses
✹ Create crafts with natural materials
✦ Thank Mother Earth with birdseeds from our Sacred Pouches
✹ Understand the importance of the 4 elements and 4 directions

Understanding Energy
✹ Protecting their energy in challenging situations
✦ Tune into and balance their chakras
✹ Cultivate awareness for the “energy bubbles” of ourselves and others
Mind-Body Connection

✦ Cultivate awareness for their own states of groundedness
✹ Use easy and powerful breathing techniques to change their emotional state
✦ Use EFT Tapping to release emotional and physical resistance
✹ Listen for the whisper of our hearts

How to Fix a Bad Day

✦ Access the peace within through visualizations
✹ Make and and utilize Meditation Jars
✦ Finding & using our power animal for inner resourcing
✹ Create a “How to Fix a Bad Day” booklet at the end of the week of all the wisdom they learn at Spirit Camp

Every child finishes Spirit Camp with their very own physical “Spirit Toolbox” full of the holistic tools that helped them transform throughout the week. These tools help foster resilience, adaptability, centeredness, and joy! Kids continue to resource their Spirit Camp tools long after the last day of camp, and for many children they become a part of their daily routine.

Want in on the fun? Parents and guardians are welcome to attend any portion of Spirit Camp. In August, we will offer a special week of Spirit Camp for Adults.

title: VMAC Next Gen Dance Camp
address: Kuhnhausen's Furniture in Portland, OR, USA, 2648 E Burnside St, Portland, OR 97214, USA
description:
- Next Gen! -
Empowered minds  -  Safe bodies -   creative play!
Summer Camps - Next Gen (vmacnextgen.com)
[SUMMER YOUTH PROGRAM]
Dance  -  Sing  -  Draw  -  Act  -  Play  -  Learn  -  REPEAT!
Summer Camps - Next Gen (vmacnextgen.com)
Program description:

It’s no secret that we value dance education and community development at VMAC. With inclusivity and diversity in mind, we created a camp that offers a spectrum of fun and creative learning opportunities for the NEXT GENERATION! Children are creative by nature, so we intend to harness that creativity and direct it back into each student by way of the arts. By incorporating games within every lesson children feel safe and stimulated while being exposed to a variety of rich and colorful art forms! We will introduce “campers” to song and dance, theater arts, and visual arts in efforts to cater to a range of learning styles and interests. Each week will culminate in a warm, yet casual showcase where campers will be celebrated and awarded for their participation and overall contribution to the program. Each camper that completes a week of camp will receive a badge of honor!

Class descriptions:

Visual arts will include arts and craft style lessons. All materials will be provided.

Song and dance will include freestyle dance, exposure to choreography, and learning lyrics and rhythms.

Theater arts will include cartoon studies, character development, and musical theater exposure.

Age groups and expectations:

Campers 5-7 will primarily focus on developing motor skills, expanding their ability to coordinate, exercise attention and retention, and most importantly, increase focus.

Campers 8-11 will be exposed to working in groups/teams, creating and developing their ideas, confidence building, learning new vocabulary, and articulating thoughts into words and other artistic expressions.

Campers 12-15 will be challenged to use their creativity while critically thinking. They will learn communication and goal setting skills that apply to art making. And finally, these campers will learn how to present their own work of art from start to finish!

Summer Camps - Next Gen (vmacnextgen.com)

title: Imagine Theatre
address: 13203 SE 172nd Ave Ste 166, Happy Valley, OR 97086, USA
description:
Originating with virtual-programming in Fall 2020, Imagine Theatre offers intentional programming for students ages 7-18 in the areas of dance, voice, acting, comedy, musical theatre and technical theater. Students explore these themes through our educational offerings (classes, workshops, camps, etc.) and performance opportunities (Mainstage offerings, and education rooted performance opportunities.)

Education - Classes, Camps, & Leadership

- Classes -

For students 7-18, Imagine offers educational programming on a quarterly basis. During our Fall, Winter, & Spring terms, students can register for classes based in the the themes of dance, voice/music, acting, musical theatre, comedy, and technical theatre. Classes are an intentional place for students to grow deep in what they love. Our three core classes (Voice Core, Dance Core, and Acting Core) are the root of all other classes. Most of the other classes offered require one or more the Core classes having been already taken.

- Camps  -

For students 7-18, Imagine offers a wide variety of summer programming that includes Camps, Intensives, and Workshops. Imagine camps are one of the best ways to first engage with the programming, as they are packed with tons of fun, learning, performances, and skilled teachers. With week-long, two-week, and evening-only offerings, there is something for everyone to enjoy!

- Artists Committed to Serve (ACTS)  -

For High school students, Imagine Theatre offers an intentional leadership program (ACTS) that empowers and guides student leaders in creating a strong community amongst all Imagine students and creating ways to meaningfully engage with the larger community around us. The ACTS team does all of this while engaging in learning about what it means to be good leaders through learning about communication styles, leadership styles, ethical leadership, community-development, organizational strategies, marketing, communications, and more.

- Teaching Artists  -

Our educational offerings are taught by skilled and experienced Teaching Artists. Many of the Imagine Theatre Teaching Artists work in the theatre/art/music field, are professional artists, and/or hold relevant degrees/certificates in theatre, education, music, etc.

Performance - Mainstage, The Studio

Imagine Theatre offers unique and meaningful performance opportunities through our Mainstage & The Studio programs.

- Mainstage -

Imagine Theatre's Mainstage program offers a stage experience for larger shows and performers of any level.

- The Studio -

Imagine Theatre's The Studio program is an intentional performance based-learning program that offers unique projects for students seeking ways to experiment, grow, and learn as artists.

title: Learn-to-Row Summer Camp 2023
address: 7815 SE Oaks Park Way, Portland, OR 97202, USA
description:
Enjoy the sunshine and water this summer and let ORU introduce you to the wonderful world of rowing! Two-week camp sessions are available from July through August. This camp is designed to give students with no prior rowing experience an opportunity to determine if rowing is a good fit and to prepare them to join ORU’s Junior Rowing Team (with the Coach’s approval) in the Fall.

Safety is our number one priority. Due to the unique demands of the sport of rowing and ORU’s summer coaching and program structure, prospective students must possess general fitness and meet the following prerequisites in order to participate in the camp:

* Be at least 13 years old;

* Weigh no more than 190 lbs (This is the maximum weight-limit of the current ORU rowing shell inventory);

* Stand at least 5'3" tall and be able to lift 25 lbs overhead (The participants of each rowing shell will work together to lift their boat into and out of the water and will carry it on their shoulders to and from the dock);

* Be able to get in and out of the rowing shells under their own power.

* Arrange and successfully complete a Swim and Float Test (or provide recognized documentation of swimming ability, such as a Red Cross Water Safety Card or Lifeguard Certification). This requirement must be satisfied prior to the first day of the LTR camp session.

* ORU is not currently equipped to offer Adaptive Rowing.

All LTR sessions are held at the Oaks Park Community Boathouse. Classes are held on M-W-F, from 8:00-10:30 AM, with the exception of Session #1 (See notification below). The cost to attend is $175/session.

Session #1: Jul 3-14, 2023

Session #2: Jul 17-28, 2023

Session #3: Jul 31-Aug 11, 2023

Session #4: Aug 14-25, 2023

All sessions are held at the Oaks Park Community Boathouse. Students will begin their session by learning water and boat safety, rowing terminology, the parts of the boat, and how to carry the boat to and from the dock. They will also learn the mechanics of the rowing stroke, including proper rowing form and sequence. Instruction begins first on land through the use of ergometers (indoor rowing machines), and then moves to the water (Willamette River), where students will learn how to safely get in and out of a shell, how to properly hold their oars, and the basic techniques of sculling. Along with gaining fitness and strength, students will enjoy team camaraderie!

title: Sauvie Island Center’s Farm Camp
address: Portland, OR, USA
description:
Sauvie Island Center’s Farm Camp is outdoor experience where children are outside all day, every day soaking up the fresh air and sunshine. Each day at camp is a new adventure as we explore and learn on our site at Topaz Farm.  The day starts with an opening circle where we might do some Sauvie Island Center yoga while listening for the call of the Red-winged blackbird.  Much of our day includes time in the Grow Lunch Garden, campers very own farm row. Together we learn about the land, care for the soil, and plant and taste all kinds of vegetables.  We may even learn about new friends like the Pacific Treefrogs who often nestle in rows colorful rainbow chard. And what camp would be complete without  traditional activities like games, camp songs, arts and crafts. Each day we focus on different parts of the Sauvie Island Center curriculum including:

Soil Exploration: Dig in and learn about healthy soil.
Seed to Harvest: Plant, tend and harvest the Grow Lunch Garden.
Plant Parts Investigation: Explore the farm and plants we can eat.
Wildlife & Food Web: Who else has been foraging on the farm?
Pollination Station: Meet these hard-working farm friends.

At the Sauvie Island Center we recognize we are growing and learning on unceded lands of the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde, who represent a portion of the original inhabitants of this land. The island known as Sauvie Island was home to a band of the Multnomah People of the Chinook Nation.

Wildlife & Food Web: Who else has been foraging on the farm?
Pollination Station: Meet these hard-working farm friends.

At the Sauvie Island Center we recognize we are growing and learning on unceded lands of the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde, who represent a portion of the original inhabitants of this land. The island known as Sauvie Island was home to a band of the Multnomah People of the Chinook Nation.

title: Montessori Children’s House
address: 3626 S Bond Ave, Portland, OR 97239, USA
description:
*Currently enrolling for immediate openings in our Primary Community (ages 3-6) *

Enrolling now for Summer 2023 and the 2023-2024 School Year

We are a year-round authentic Montessori School; we enroll on a rolling basis.  We have two Toddler Communities (ages 16-36 months) and two Primary Communities (ages 3-6 years). 

Contact us today!

At Montessori Children’s House, our aim is to support your child’s natural development, building the capability to become a productive, fulfilled adult who contributes to the world. We partner with parents and caregivers to develop children who are morally, emotionally, and behaviorally prepared for the real world. Our staff help children follow their interests and passions to develop strong skills in academics, leadership, self-discipline, responsibility, independence, and initiative. Your child’s education will be hands-on, self-paced, collaborative, and joyful — everything needed to create a lifelong learner and doer.

title: Sauvie Island Center’s Farm Camp
address: Portland, OR, USA
description:
Sauvie Island Center’s Farm Camp is outdoor experience where children are outside all day, every day soaking up the fresh air and sunshine. Each day at camp is a new adventure as we explore and learn on our site at Topaz Farm.  The day starts with an opening circle where we might do some Sauvie Island Center yoga while listening for the call of the Red-winged blackbird.  Much of our day includes time in the Grow Lunch Garden, campers very own farm row. Together we learn about the land, care for the soil, and plant and taste all kinds of vegetables.  We may even learn about new friends like the Pacific Treefrogs who often nestle in rows colorful rainbow chard. And what camp would be complete without  traditional activities like games, camp songs, arts and crafts. Each day we focus on different parts of the Sauvie Island Center curriculum including:

Soil Exploration: Dig in and learn about healthy soil.
Seed to Harvest: Plant, tend and harvest the Grow Lunch Garden.
Plant Parts Investigation: Explore the farm and plants we can eat.
Wildlife & Food Web: Who else has been foraging on the farm?
Pollination Station: Meet these hard-working farm friends.

At the Sauvie Island Center we recognize we are growing and learning on unceded lands of the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde, who represent a portion of the original inhabitants of this land. The island known as Sauvie Island was home to a band of the Multnomah People of the Chinook Nation.

title: Camp Invention
address: Portland, OR, USA
description:
In partnership with the National Inventors Hall of Fame® (NIHF), Portland is pleased to offer the nationally acclaimed Camp Invention program to children entering kindergarten through sixth grade. This exciting, weeklong summer adventure provides opportunities for open-ended, hands-on exploration of science, technology, engineering and more! Rotating through a variety of exciting activities each day, children have fun collaborating with friends, thinking creatively and inventing their own solutions to real-world challenges. The all-new 2022 program will thrill both new and returning campers with an expedition full of far-reaching explorations, fascinating discoveries and exhilarating “a-ha” moments!

During this dynamic, high-energy program, young innovators will:
• Dive into cutting-edge ocean research as they adopt their own robotic fish, design and patent aquatic plants, and take their fish friend home in a mini tank.

• Discover real space exploration technology when they create Spacepacks and AstroArm devices, mine an asteroid and observe erupting ice volcanoes.

• Combine science and art to build their own robotic artist, engage in design thinking, make spin art and learn how inventions can change the way people create.

• Experiment with the fun of physics, engineering and gaming as they design, build and test their own mega marble arcades.

Early registration discounts are available! Availability is limited, so visit invent.org/local or call 800-968-4332 to secure your child’s spot today!

title: Code Ninjas Hillsboro
address: 135 NE 43rd Ave, Portland, OR 97213, USA
description:
A world where kids write the code.™

Does your child like video games? They will love Code Ninjas! Transform your child's love for technology into an exciting learning adventure. Code Ninjas Hillsboro offers regular classes, workshops, camps, birthdays, and more!

CAMPS: Our camps offer an immersive environment for kids 5-14 to explore and develop new skills, gain confidence, and have fun with friends. It's an unforgettable experience! Open to the public. 

SPRING BREAK CAMP:
March 27-31 Makers with Microcontrollers in the morning and Code Your Own Arcade in the afternoon! Sign up for both and stay all day.

SUMMER CAMP: 4 camps every week from June 19th to August 25th. 
Click here to see all of our Summer Camp details!  Early Bird Special ends February 28th! 

Camps for Kids 5-7: JR Adventures in Game Design, JR Inventors with Makey Makey, JR Makers with Microcontrollers, and JR STEM Discoveries.

Camps for Kids 8+: 3D Design and Print, Become a YouTuber, Code Your Own Arcade, Create and Compete, Intro to Roblox Development, Makers with Microcontrollers, Modding with Minecraft, Robotics with LEGO, and Stop Motion Animation.

Camps for Kids 10+: Intro to Web Development, LEGO Python Engineers, and Operation: Code Breakers.

Morning camps: 9AM -12pm.
Afternoon camps: 12:30PM - 3:30PM
Sign up for an AM and PM camp to stay all day! 

CLASSES

Code Ninjas JR (ages 5-7) builds a foundation of coding and problem-solving skills through our fun and completely visual curriculum – no reading required! Our world-class program combines storytelling and game building with hands-on projects for an immersive education experience.

Create  (ages 8-14) Kids come to our center 2 hours a week and have a blast building awesome video games and developing ninja coding skills on the path from white to black belt. Our fun program lets kids learn to code year-round at their own pace! When they need help, our amazing senseis provide 1 on 1 tutoring to support the kids with exactly what they need. This design allows lots of flexibility for parents! Parents just use our app to schedule the hours that they want to come each week.

WORKSHOPS Open to the public. All kids 7-14 are welcome!

Roblox Play: Calling all Roblox fans! Each week, kids can come together and play their favorite Roblox games! This is a great opportunity to let your child play with other kids in a supervised setting! Every Tuesday at 5pm  

Minecraft Creative Building: Bring out your creative building skills in Minecraft EDU. Fellow Minecrafters can get together to discuss Minecraft and share tips and tricks for building. What is the format for the workshop? The group will choose their focus for the day from a list of themes, have building time, and finish by sharing what each builder created. Every Tuesday at 6pm

PARENT'S NIGHT OUT  You deserve a night on the town. Meanwhile, your kids want to play and have fun. That's why we offer Parent's Night Out - a win-win evening for families. Drop off your kids at Code Ninjas, where they'll play games, eat pizza, and more! Once you've had a chance to unwind, swing by to pick them up (please) and hear about all the fun they've had! Parent's Night Out is offered on the 2nd Saturday of every month. Open to the public. All kids 7-14 are welcome!

10+ Gamer Nights: Calling all gamers: Come spend your Friday night with us! On the third Friday of every month we open our doors late (7-9pm) for our older gamers. (Found on our website under Parent's Night Out, but no food is served at Gamer Nights.) Open to the public. All kids 10-14 are welcome!

Birthday Parties - contact us for more information!

Give your child an epic birthday this year with Code Ninjas!  Our basic party includes :
8 kids, not including the birthday child
Rental of whole facility for 2 hours
1.5 hours of hosted game time with our gaming laptops (light up mouse and mouse pad!)
30 minutes in lobby for cake and presents with tables and chairs provided
Set up/clean up of cake & beverages
Cake cutting & service
Outside cake and drinks allowed (in lobby only)
Free Game-Building Session voucher for each party guest.
1 choice of Minecraft, Roblox, or Super Smash Bros activities

Upgrade your package to get more time, a shirt for the birthday child, and more!

Code Ninjas Hillsboro
KIDS HAVE FUN, PARENTS SEE RESULTS®

address: 1420 NW 17th Ave, Portland, OR 97209, USA
description: DANCE CLASSES + SUMMER WORKSHOPS + BIRTHDAY PARTIES for ages 2-8 IMA Summer Workshops offer an introduction to a variety of dance styles as well as cultural context of where the movement styles come from. Some of the workshops for older children combine dance and science around themes of water, wind and light. Hands-on craft projects and science experiments foster a deeper connection with the material. Ballet Classes are offered during the school year in 3 levels, each of which is taught in either English or beginning French. The Toddler class allows for a parent/guardian to participate with their little dancer. Miss Ella’s teaching approach is to encourage imagination and fun. She is dedicated to bringing the magic of dance to children and inspiring them for the future. Ballerina Party Entertainer is a perfect way to get kids dancing, being creative and having fun together. Miss Ella has wonderful themes and imaginative storylines that kids help create and bring to life as a group. At the end there is a chance for every participant to do a small solo and receive a prize.

title: Independent Publishing Resource Center (IPRC)
address: 318 SE Main St, Portland, OR 97214, USA
description:
The IPRC's mission is to provide affordable access to space, tools, and resources for creating independently published media and artwork, and to build community and identity through the creation of written and visual art. We nurture collaboration, creativity, and community-building through access to shared print-studio space, educational programming, and community events for writers, artists, printmakers, organizers, and small publishers. We provide equitable access to tools, resources, and unconditional support for Portlanders to share the stories & causes closest to their hearts through the production of independently-published zines, prints, chapbooks, art books, chapbooks, prints, and print ephemera. The IPRC exists to demystify print & publishing processes, and remove barriers to creative expression.

Show:Tell Youth Camps are week-long offerings for Middle Grades and High School Artists and Writers, with opportunities to learn, explore, and make Comics, Zines, Screenprints, Letterpress Prints, Bookarts and Creative Writing with IPRC Teaching Artists. Registration includes a year of IPRC Membership to encourage print & zine-making all year long.

title: Write Now Portland- Creative Writing and Nature Play Camp
address: Mt Tabor Park, SE 60th Ave &, SE Salmon St, Portland, OR 97215, USA
description:
In the Write Now Portland Summer Camps, we teach creative writing and play games outdoors at Mt. Tabor Park in SE Portland. Each camp is limited to 10-12 students. In this small group setting, students learn what makes writing strong, the three pillars of every story, and how to use the 5 senses to bring their writing alive. They will have quiet time to write, to share and give compliments, and to play. Students of all writing levels are welcome. This camp is most effective for students who have some motivation to write and can work independently with guidance. By the end of the week, students will have special spots in the park that they feel connected to, will have a story started and developed, and will have become better writers; all while having fun. This camp is open ended and can be repeated throughout the summer. Students can bring projects they are already working on or begin something new. We help students get ideas, too.

One of our favorite quotes about this camp came from a 4th grade boy who said last summer, "I woke up with a smile on my face every day just knowing that I got to come to this camp."
Your child will develop writing skills, play a variety of games in nature, and expand their creativity.
For ages 8-12 years old. All camps are half-day, 9 am-12 pm.
The schedule can be found at http://www.writenowportland.com/summer-camps.html

title: IMA Academy
address: 1420 NW 17th Ave, Portland, OR 97209, USA
description: DANCE CLASSES + SUMMER WORKSHOPS + BIRTHDAY PARTIES for ages 2-8 IMA Summer Workshops offer an introduction to a variety of dance styles as well as cultural context of where the movement styles come from. Some of the workshops for older children combine dance and science around themes of water, wind and light. Hands-on craft projects and science experiments foster a deeper connection with the material. Ballet Classes are offered during the school year in 3 levels, each of which is taught in either English or beginning French. The Toddler class allows for a parent/guardian to participate with their little dancer. Miss Ella’s teaching approach is to encourage imagination and fun. She is dedicated to bringing the magic of dance to children and inspiring them for the future. Ballerina Party Entertainer is a perfect way to get kids dancing, being creative and having fun together. Miss Ella has wonderful themes and imaginative storylines that kids help create and bring to life as a group. At the end there is a chance for every participant to do a small solo and receive a prize.
